Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's decision based on credibility issues
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found inconsistencies in applicant's story
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, travel records, identity documents
Crimes.Legal_Provision: subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness standard as per Dunsmuir and Aguebor
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistent statements about passport issuance and entry stamps
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide supporting evidence for claims
Crimes.Authority: Dunsmuir v. New Brunswick; Aguebor v. Canada
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent and unsupported evidence regarding travel and documents
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation for return to Pakistan, suspicious passport issuance
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Properly conducted hearing with opportunity to respond
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Implausible explanations about passport use while allegedly in U.S.
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review challenging reasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review for factual findings
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to produce travel or identity documentation

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's credibility findings
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant's evidence inconsistent and implausible
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Travel history, visa records, personal testimony
Crimes.Legal_Provision: subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Possession of 2001 passport with valid visa despite claiming non-use
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to substantiate presence in Pakistan and travel claims
Crimes.Application_Factor: Inconsistencies in travel timeline and document usage
Crimes.Authority: Dunsmuir v. New Brunswick; Aguebor v. Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentation for key events
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Opportunity to present case fairly provided
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Implausible narrative about passport never being used
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review for factual findings

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possibly overstaying visa in the United States
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim involving foreign immigration violations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of factual findings on credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Applicant lived illegally in U.S. from 2001–2006
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish well-founded fear
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: History of illegal stay in the U.S.
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Convention refugee status requires well-founded fear of persecution
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to political opinion
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Duration and legality of U.S. residence, satellite dish persecution claim
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Board maintained rejection based on credibility
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Certification of question or quashing of decision

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of rejecting claim due to use of fraudulent documents
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant not credible due to fraudulent entry method
Crimes.Legal_Provision: subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Entry into Canada using a fraudulent passport
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to explain or justify use of fraudulent passport
Crimes.Application_Factor: Use of fraudulent travel document at port of entry
Crimes.Authority: Dunsmuir v. New Brunswick; Aguebor v. Canada
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence and use of fraudulent passport
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: No proof of return to Pakistan, unexplained possession of passport
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Fair opportunity to respond to allegations
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Implausible explanations including satellite dish persecution
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review for factual findings
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose true identity or travel history
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and use of false document

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of factual findings on document authenticity
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Presence of counterfeit stamp in travel document
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Requirement for truthful and complete disclosure in refugee claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Fairness of reliance on forensic document analysis
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant had chance to address document concerns
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Passport with counterfeit stamp, implausible persecution narrative
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Contested reasonableness of adverse credibility finding
